reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We started our vacation off at Henry IV and absolutly loved it! It is a quaint, beautiful hotel and the staff is outstanding. We loved it from the second we pulled up and saw the red door. They took care of every need immediatly and provided us with all the help and information we needed to get around the city. The room was more than enough, and the small table with kitchenette was perfect for our small breakfast of breads and coffee. They were more than accomodating. We asked advice on everything from how to find the Eiffle Tower to where to get the best bread, wine and cheese and always were pleased with the results. We even had a little balcony with a small table and chairs and had a wonderful view as we wereon the top floor. The staff made sure we were comfortable and our needs were taken care of. We even forgot a cold pack, special butter and an insulated bag when we left to continue our vacation of Europe. We called two days later and ased if it was still there. It was. We arrived back to Paris 10 days later, and they still had our things. These people are VERY good at what they do!
reviews.title: LOVED IT!

likes.liked: — Room size, view, staff, atmosphere, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 3 nights in Hotel Residence Henri IV and found it to be entirely positive except for the proximity of our room to the elevator which seemed to be pretty noisy most of the time.
reviews.title: A little gem in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Number 22 i s I think a "surperior" room and as such had a great little sitting room and a double balcony overlooking a pretty park.
reviews.title: Paris hideaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Loved the kitchenette as this is a great cost saver and allowed us to eat what and when we chose. Need to improvise as only 1 pot provided but this was not a problem for us. Definitely would save on the very basic breakfast and prepare something in the room or go out for a bite to eat.
reviews.title: Loved it!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The decor is basic but pleasant and the bed was really comfy.
reviews.title: A beautiful little hotel in a great locaation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best recommendation we could give: We will stay with them again! Fabulous location, which is paramount for us. The room was clean and larger than any we have experienced in Paris. The bathroom was large and new. I think the hotel had been recently renovated and it was pristine. The front desk was helpful and friendly. The breakfast was the only minus - However, the need thereof forced us to find charming and very tasty boulangeries close by. Finally, the price for value is as good as it gets. I recommend highly.
reviews.title: A+ for the Hotel Residence Henri IV
Careful
reviews.text: Unfortunately, the booking practice of this hotel appears to be deceptive. A few days ago I was offered a "last minute" rate which I accepted and furnished my credit card details within the period required by the hotel. Their response was they were sorry but the room had already been rented. We all know that the hotels will hold a

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: room for a definite period pending receipt of credit card details so there was no mistake. Obviously, they found someone to rent at the normal rate. I am sure the hotel is lovely but the traveler needs to be careful in dealing with them. This is an issue of honesty. My wife
reviews.title: We loved it!
unique hotel
reviews.text: had warned me to look elsewhere after reading the recent report on Tripadvisor of items being stolen from a room at night. I should have

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: listened. I am sure the manager will reply with his explanation of the "mistake." This was not a mistake! Shame, shame!!"
reviews.title: Excellent staff who provided superb recommendations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Down a little side street this charming little hotel waits for you. The staff are very pleasant and helpful and the hotel enjoys a good location 5 minutes walk to the Notre Dame and Pantheon, 20 minutes walk to Musee D'Orsay, 30 minutes walk to Eiffel Tower and 20 minutes walk across the river to Louvre.
reviews.title: Charming centrally located Parisien hotel

likes.disliked: — The spiral staircase when the lift to the top floor wasn't working....very dizzying!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's location also takes the problem out of where to eat in the evening since you are literally surrounded by great bistrots and restaurants and cafes, albeit a lot very touristy but you can usually take an educated guess which ones are the tourist havens by the nature of their menu!
reviews.title: Great Paris hotel if you can get a good rate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose a superior room booked directly with the hotel which was a nice sized compfortable bed with reasonable furniture in the bedroom and a small lounge area with table and chairs and sofa. We paid 180euro per night for this and breakfast was extra (6euro each....but to be honest, skip it and go to the nearby cafe's!). I've stayed in worse places for similar money in Paris and this is as comfortable as you will find oif you are trudging the city all day without forking out high prices for the room you wont really use that much!
reviews.title: Yes, nice little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very enjoyable indeed and I'd certainly use it again.
reviews.title: Great location, great little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is in a great location, couple of minutes from the Metro, about 10 minutes walk to Notre Dame. Also handy for Rue Mouffetard and in about 15 minutes you can be in the Marais.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is a wonderful, small (13-room) and nicely furnished three-star hotel on a quiet deadend street near the Metro Maubert-Mutualite stop in the Latin Quarter. We spent five nights in an apartment accompanied by a granddaughter. The apartment consisted of two BR, an ample bathroom and a small kitchen. The staff is very helpful and pleasant, the rooms supplied with fresh linens and cleaned daily, and the price is reasonable. We stayed here in 2004 also. Close by is the exceptional Keyser boulangerie, our first morning stop to gather baguettes, brioches and croissants to take home for breakfast.
reviews.title: convenient and quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a lovely small hotel. It is very Parisien and conveniently located. HIghly recommended.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband, I and two children (11 and 17) stayed in the Hotel Henri for two nights. What a gem this hotel is in Paris. The rooms are spacious and very clean. We did not have breakfast at the hotel as the children are very fussy eaters. We bought goodies from a supermarket within walking distance of the hotel and made use of the self-catering equipment in the room. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will definately stay there again in future.
reviews.title: Magnificant stay in Paris

likes.liked: — Very clean and spacious. Self catering with fridge. Close to Notre Dame.
likes.disliked: — There was not a kettle in the room, but could boil water in microwave or on stove top.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is perfect for a stay in Paris. So perfect that I am hesitant to write a review, as it might become too popular. Without a doubt we will be staying here on any future visit to Paris.
reviews.title: perfect.

likes.disliked: — we didn't stay for long enough!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room was comfortable and nicely furnished. The large floor to ceiling windows in both the bedroom and bathroom meant we could get a nice breeze through the room. Very little noise, considering it is in a city.
reviews.title: Cute Parisian experience

likes.liked: — Feeling like we lived in Paris.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Very pleasant hotel in a central location, just few minutes from the Pantheon and Notre Dame. Extremely clean. Well trained, always helpful staff. Great service.
reviews.title: Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Lovely , charming, friendly, comfortable and clean hotel. In a great location, very close to 2 metro stations and walking distance from Notre Dame. Hotel staff very helpful and friendly. When I return to Paris I will stay here again.
reviews.title: Ideal place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of HRH IV is perfect -- on a quiet street in the busy Latin Quarter. The multilingual staff go out of their way to help. Despite the chilly weather outside, the room was warm and cozy. If you need your coffee first thing in the morning (as I do) the breakfast in the basement is a good idea; otherwise, it seems a bit dreary down there. In all other ways, HRH IV is a great value.
reviews.title: excellent choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very pleasant helpful staff (directed us to a great restaurant round the corner) and lovely comfortable clean rooms. Even one of the cleaners we met was nice and helpful. Decorated in that old school, slightly chintzy neo-Roccoco French style – not particularly my taste but what the hell, when in Rome [err..] etc. Very quiet little cul-de-sac, but only a stone’s throw from Notre Dame, Pantheon, Boulevard St Germain and all the associated action you’d expect. Recommended.
reviews.title: Very nice, intimate hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed the Henri IV. The rooms were very nice, the staff wonderful and the location couldn't be better. Having visited Paris many times, this is the first hotel I would really enjoy returning to stay in. My one suggestion for the hotel (and this is NOT a complaint), is to do a little research and have more non-smoking restaurant suggestions for the guests. Given that you are a non-smoking hotel, I think quite a few people who stay with you are probably looking for this and it would be very helpful. There are so many restuarants in Paris and it can be daunting to sort through them. All in all, a wonderful experience in a Paris hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel - fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 6 week European trip. The majority of our accomodation was booked after reading reviews from Trip Advisor. Hotel Residence Henri IV was a great little find. They provided us with directions from the main station. The hotel is situated in the famous Latin Quarter in a quiet strret overlooking a park and eveything is within walking distance or easily accessible by public transport (e.g. Notre Dame is a 5 min walk.) The hotel is small with only 2 rooms per floor. We stayed in a superior room that provided a pull out sofa bed in the lounge and 2 single beds pushed together to make up a king sized bed in the bedroom. The bathroom was large with heated towel racks and all the ammenities you would expect . An added bonus was a tiny kitchenette with a microwave, bar fridge and hot plate. There was a market down the road where you could buy many delicious things to bring back to the room. Breakfast was not included in our tarrif but there is pleny of variety nearby.
reviews.title: A little sanctuary

likes.disliked: — The sofa bed was too small for two people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff were very attentive and polite.
reviews.title: Harris 2 adults 2 children

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Overall, this is one of my favourite hotels from the trip. Our room was fantastic for 2, great for 3 and adequate for 4. My children found the sofa bed a liitle tight and the hotel was not able to provide any additional bedding.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location
reviews.title: Nice Place to stay

likes.liked: — Calm place but yet not far from Metro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Excellent Room
reviews.title: Perfect for a small family!
Loved the Residence Henri IV
reviews.text: The hotel is wonderfully located for neighborhood dining and for access to tourist attractions. We and our daughter's family of five enjoyed attentive and personal service of attractive and well informed staff who spoke excellent English. They also were most patient with our attempts at communication in French. The room amenities were fine and the size of the hotel (only 13 rooms) was perfect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008
reviews.text: Sincerely, The Sincocks
reviews.title: Ideal location, charming hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel with my husband and mother-in-law for 4 nights in mid-March. My mother-in-law was visiting from the US, and as this stay in Paris was her first introduction to Europe, we wanted to ensure that our hotel was well-located in relation to most of the major sites. My husband and I have stayed in Paris several times, and this location was by far the best that we've stayed in. It is a comfortable walk (approximately 10 minutes) from Notre Dame. The train from CDG airport also drops you about a 15 minute walk from the hotel--very convenient. Furthermore, as other reviewers have noted, the hotel is located at the end of a small street, meaning that the location is quiet in the evening--a plus when sleeping.
reviews.title: Great little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms themselves were relatively large by Paris standards, meaning still small, but comfortable. The front desk staff was friendly, and when we arrived significantly before checkin, it was not a problem to store our bags for an hour while they quickly prepared our room.
reviews.title: Keeping the Residence Henri IV a secret!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate breakfast in the hotel one morning, but weren't terribly impressed. As another reviewer has noted, the breakfast room is in the basement.
reviews.title: Terrific Little Hotel!

likes.disliked: — The mattress could have been more comfortable. Not great if you have any kind of back or neck problems.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Hotel Residence Henri IV is in a great part of town and very convenient to many of the popular tourist attractions. The hotel is at the end of dead end street which makes the immiediate area a little more quiet and intimate. However, once you walk to the first intersection, you are in the heart of the Latin Quarter, surrounded by shops, restaurants, bakeries and cafes and just a few minute's walk from Notre Dame. A metro station is around a 10 minute walk from the hotel.
reviews.title: Highly Recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel's staf was friendly, helpful and pretty good with English.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

likes.liked: — Large, rooms and helpful staff that spoke English

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had what was called an apartment for four people -- my wife and I plus our two daughters. The room had a bedroom with a queen size bed and a living roon with a pull-out sofa. The pull-out bed was small for two people (even if one of the two was my six-year-old daughter). The room also had a kitchenette which we did not use. The hotel and room were both older but very clean. The room was adequate for us. There were a couple of disappointing aspects to the room. The towels in the bathroom were threadbare and the toilet seat was worn (not dirty).
reviews.title: Loved the Hotel Residence Henri 1V

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast room was in the basement and not a particularly great place to start your day in Paris. The breakfast was OK. We ate there only one day when we were in a rush. We enjoyed our breakfasts at the local cafes much more.
reviews.title: Fabulous Location, Excellent Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In summary -- very nice and friendly hotel in a great location. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Perfect Place in Paris

likes.disliked: — a shelf in the bathroom would be nice for toiletry items

reviews.title: A Charming and Comfortable Hotel
reviews.text: My husband, son, and I very much enjoyed our 5-night stay at Residence Henri IV, and will definitely stay there again. We were very comfortable: while the hotel is small and charming, the room we had was spacious, especially for Paris (two separate rooms with beds, a kitchenette, and a large marble bathroom). There's lots of light, easy wifi, plenty of plugs, and the most wonderful staff -- the woman and two men who in turn staffed the front desk were always willing to help with a smile, giving us information about museum passes, metro access, sites, distances, taxis, location of a nearby grocery, good bakery, etc., and I even got crucial help in a wardrobe crisis. This is in stark contrast to the report we got from a friend who stayed in an upscale Paris hotel last year. Members of the housekeeping staff were also gracious, instilling a sense of security, and they consistently did a great job with the room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is good for sight-seeing and sleeping well. The hotel is
reviews.title: Loved the Hotel Residence Henri IV
great hotel in a great city
reviews.text: located at the end of a short street, across from a park, so it's very quiet, but at the same time, it's only a couple of blocks from Blvd. Saint-Germain, and a few more blocks over to Blvd. Saint-Michel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was clean and bright, staff very friendly. Convenient location for many restuarants and metro. Would happily recommend this hotel. Book early to take advantage of their special rates.
reviews.title: Great small hotel
Hotel Residence Henri IV is trully my residence in Paris
reviews.text: This January, my husband, daughter and I stayed for the 4th time at our beloved Residence Henry IV. It truly has a homey feeling. The people who work there are friendly, it is in a nice calm street but in the middle of the Latin Quarter, the apartments are small but cozy, nice and clean, and it is not overpriced in spite of the weakness of the dollar. We'll definitely be going back. My only reservation about writing a review is that I would like to keep it a secret...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband and two children (aged 10 and 13) recently returned from Paris after staying at this delightful establishment. It is in a great location very close to Notre Dame and the Metro. The decor and ambiance are completely lovely and the room sizes (25m2) were great as we had been told to expect tiny rooms in Paris. The staff were professional, friendly and very helpful. They spoke English and were most helpful to us as both my husband and daughter became ill and needed to see a doctor. The staff arranged appointments and provided directions for us, we simply couldnt have done it so easily without them.I would have no hesitation in recommeding this hotel to anyone and should we return to Paris we would hope to be able to stay there again.
reviews.title: Hooray for Henri IV

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel. It was in a wonderful location, close to many restaurants, shops, train stations and even a coin laundry! The room was comfortable and well appointed; the kitchenette was especially handy.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel!!!
Excellent - perfect price with their offer
reviews.text: The staff were friendly and helpful. My husband was not well when we arrived, so the concierge booked us an appointment at a local doctor. On departure, they arranged an airport shuttle for us at a much cheaper rate than a taxi cab.
